oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Aerial photograph of North Nashville, ca. 1968.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Aerial photograph of North Nashville, looking southwest, circa 1968, taken by Metro Photographer William M. King. Photograph displays an unidentified industrial area on the upper left side with a railroad passing through it. The image shows fields in the foreground with what appears to be a wooded residential area in the background, and a small number of unidentified buildings below the railroad on the left side. On the upper right of the image is the edge of the Cumberland River lowlands. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.

Interstate 265 would pass through this location when it was built between 1968 and 1971. In 2000, Interstate 265 ceased to exist, and was redesignated as part of Interstate 65. This area is also the site of future development of the eastern section of MetroCenter.
